intro: Chrysochlamys costaricana, commonly known as the Costa Rican goldenbush, is a shrub native to the tropical regions of Central America. It belongs to the family Rutaceae, which includes plants known for their aromatic properties. The plant is characterized by its dense, evergreen foliage and clusters of small, yellowish-green flowers. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in cloud forests. Due to its ornamental value and ecological importance, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens and conservation programs.
